content.description: This is a great climb covered with large holds for your hands and feet.  This climb has a fun little overhang that is great to practice your technique or beginners can even choose to go around.
content.protection: [9] quickdraws, two more for top anchor, and a 60 meter rope.
content.location: This is the fourth climb from the left of nine routes.

content.description: This is a great climb that lets you work on placement of feet and allows you to attack the small overhang.  There is one section in the middle where you will need to smear your feet.
content.location: Third climb from the right of nine routes.

content.description: This climb is missing its 3rd or 4th bolt.  With all the other good climbs on this rock, it may be one to avoid until you are warmed up.
content.location: This is the second climb from the left of nine routes.

content.description: This one of the better climbs on Cecil Rock.  The beginning sections is a bit of a slab, and the second bolt can be a challenge to clip.  Climb up the right side of the crack to the second overhang where you are challenged with a larger overhang.  There are some bomber holds and good use of feet.
content.location: This is the third bolted route from the left.

content.description: This is a good starter climb for beginners.  The rocks a bit dirty on the left side. The belay station is on a slope which makes it a trick start if you want to keep your shoes out of the dirt.
content.location: This is the farthest climb on the left of nine routes.

content.description:
I am mostly adding this for the sake of history, but it certainly has potential. This crack is rarely climbed, and as a result, the crack is dirty and vegetated, making it very difficult to place gear (hence my PG-13 suggestion). It shares anchors with

Wily Coyote

and makes for a fun toprope if you did not bring cams or gardening gloves.
content.location:
It ascends the obvious crack between

Hyena Crack

and

Wily Coyote

.

content.description: This is a fun climb.  It has good first couple of moves with good holds.  There is a bit of a slab in the middle which gives the route its +.  All your holds are there, just take a second and look for them.
content.location: It is the fifth climb from the left of nine routes.

content.description: It is pumpy for the first few moves up the overhang.  Be careful of runout on the first few clips.  The rest of the way is similar to other Cecil climbs.
content.protection: 7 bolts or so and a rope.
content.location: This is the right-most climb before you turn the corner.

content.description: This is a fun climb and a great climb if you want to get away from other climbers on Cecil.  Climb up the right side on the path and clip the first bolt, then lower down to the bottom to attack the overhang.
content.location: This is the rightmost route of nine routes.
